Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu lā ginnu (white scrap unstamped silver with 1/8 alloy)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Previous transaction Dar 213, later transaction TCL 13, 185. The year of writing this tablet has been reconstructed from these tablets by Abraham.    According to Abraham's edition, the BM number and acquisition number to this tablet are unknown, but the BM website provides this information while referring to Bertin 2800 and Abraham 2004, no. 1.
Author: Maarja Seire (15/01/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; lē’û (register); makkūr Bēl (land of god Bēl); suluppū (dates)
Comments: Nabû-bullissu has to register the receipt of dates from Marduk-nāṣir-apli in the register of Bēl, for the account of Dahhûa and Bēl-aplu-iddin.
Author: Maarja Seire (15/01/2018)

Main Objects: ilku (corvée)

Comments: The slave is manumitted, receives a date palm garden from his former master, and is obligated to deliver 150 vats of beer for the offerings (to Nabû presumably) per year to his former master. The ex-slave will also receive barley rations from his former master.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (15/01/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); kaspu peṣû bitqu lā ginnu (unstamped white silver with 1/8 alloy); rukkubu (cargo boat); sahlû (cress); šīmu (price); sû (reed mat)
Comments: Cf. Abraham 2004, 29; the boat is first identified as GIŠ.MÁ, the last lines of text add that it is a rukkubu boat.

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See BM 102251.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (15/01/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); manâtu (account tablet); šādidu (boat tower)
Comments: According to the document, 6 boat towers have been received, but the tablet lists only 4. However, it seems to include Libluṭ and Erība?-Marduk as boat towers.    Cf. BM 30795
Author: Maarja Seire (16/01/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); idū (rent); kaspu peṣû (white silver); kaspu peṣû nuhhutu (white scrap silver); kurummatu (ration); malāhūtu (sailor’s trade)

Comments: Gūzānu, the obligor, has to go to Babylon to come to an agreement with Marduk-nāṣir-apli, the obligee.

Author: Maarja Seire (17/01/2018)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); mâr banûtu (status of a citizen); šīmu (price); sipru (document in Aramaic)
Comments: The duplicate BM 31375 (76-11-17, 1102) is unpublished.
Author: Maarja Seire (17/01/2018)

Main Objects: billatu (beer); dannu (vat); eššešu (a temple festival); Ezida bīt Nabû (temple of Nabû in Borsippa); gabrû (copy); kapru (beer offering); kaspu (silver); Mullissu (Ninlil); Nabû; narkabtu (deified chariot); Šamaš; sirāšûtu (brewer’s prebend); takpurtu (equalising payment); tardennu (beer offering); tilimtu (container); ṭuppi zitti (inheritance document)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (17/01/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: The duplicate is published in Wunsch 1993b, no. 3 and in hand copy in Nbk 201.
Author: Maarja Seire (17/01/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); nikkassu (account); nudunnû (dowry)
Comments: This is a note recording that Zēria gave silver as a dowry to Iddin-Marduk, that the silver is due from Iddin-Marduk and Kāṣiru, and that they have not settled their accounts yet. Cf. Roth 1991, p. 24 n. 10.
Author: Maarja Seire (17/01/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu ša ina 1 šiqil girê (silver which has 1/12 alloy per shekel); kaspu ša ina 1 šiqil hummušu (silver which has 1/5 of a shekel of alloy in each shekel); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The text records that a part of the silver which is due from Mušēzib-Marduk, belongs to Širiktu(/Nūrea//Dannēa)'s investments in a partnership business. The creditor, who is not mentioned, is Iddin-Marduk/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/01/2018)

Main Objects: ahu (half); harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); mimma mala ina āli u ṣēri (profits in town and countryside); rašûtu (credit); utru (profit); zittu (share)
Comments: Creation of sister company.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/01/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; ebūru (usufruct); eqlu (field); hubullu (interest); kālû (dike, marshy ground, waterlogged area); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); rašûtu (credit); zēru (arable land); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: There is no interest on the silver. Instead, the creditors can enjoy the usufruct of the pledged land.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/01/2018)

Main Objects: eqlu (field); kālû (dike, marshy ground, waterlogged area); kaspu (silver); kirî gišimmarī zaqpu (planted date palm grove); mahīru (market rate); maškanu (pledge); nīš ili u šarri (oath); nudunnû (dowry); pīhat Cutha (district of Cutha); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); ugāru (meadowland); zēru (arable land); zittu (share)
Comments: The purchase money is also used to pay off the creditor to whom this land was pledged.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/01/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; šīmu (price); zēru (arable land)
Comments: Witness list and scribe's name broken. Only a part of the obverse is preserved. Wunsch mentions traces of a seal caption.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/01/2018)

Main Objects: abulli Enlil (Enlil Gate); alpu (bull, ox); atru (additional payment); eqel ṣēri (open country); Esagil (temple of Marduk in Babylon); gišimmaru rabû (full grown date palm); kaspu (silver); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); mahīru (market rate); makallû ša hanšê (mooring place of the hanšû-land); makkūr Marduk (land of god Marduk); Marduk; mērešu (grain-cultivated land); pīhat šarri (royal district); šīmu (price); šullundu (compensation payment); šuqultu (value); taptû (newly cleared land); ṭuppu (tablet, record); zēru gišimmarī zaqpu (land planted with date palms); zēru tālāni (land with young date palms)
Comments: The tablet comments on the bordering areas very explicitly. Besides the attested neighbours the land is situated next to the royal domain and the dam of the hanšus in the open country (eqel ṣēri).    The silver will be used to compensate the Esagil temple for the bulls that the sellers of the land had bought.    In rev. 35 the sellers are referred to as 'the descendants (DUMU.MEŠ) of Ēṭiru'.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/01/2018)

Main Objects: dibbu (dispute); ebūru (harvest); eqlu (field); hubuttūtu (interest free loan); kaspu (silver); kirî gišimmarī (date palm grove); maškanu (pledge); nishu (expenses, payment for workers); pīhat Cutha (district of Cutha); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); rīmūtu (gift); širiktu (gift; votive offering); ugāru (meadowland); zittu (share)
Comments: RTC 12 A and B (new number A 1567 and A 1585, previously R. Campell Thompson, now University Museum, Chicago). The document includes the formula: pāni PN1, PN2, PN3, PN4, PN5, PN6 dayyānē šaṭāri šāṭir + PN7 & PN8 ṭupšarrū ("in front of ... the judges, the document was written, ... the scribes").
Author: Maarja Seire (19/01/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); broken/unclear; eqlu (field); eqlu gišimmaru zaqpu (field planted with date palms); eqlu mērešu u taptû (grain-cultivated and newly cleared field); kaspu (silver); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); mahīru (market rate); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); zēru (arable land)
Comments: The name of one of the witnesses is broken. It is possible that this is an official document with judges and notaries present and their seals used, but the witness list is badly damaged. BM 32184 (Wunsch 2000b, no. 7) refers to the same purchase.
Author: Maarja Seire (19/01/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 32640 (Wunsch 2000b, no. 5A). BM 48351 is a smaller fragment.
Author: Maarja Seire (19/01/2018)

Main Objects: makallû ša hanšê (mooring place of the hanšû-land); mû (water); mūṣû (exit street); šaṭāru (record); zaqpu (planted with palm trees); zēru (arable land); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: The document relates to an inheritance and is essentially a field plan. The obverse contains the exact measurements, cf. BM 30365 + BM 32216. The edges mention neighbours. The reverse explains how the property is divided between an uncle and his nephew.
Author: Maarja Seire (19/01/2018)

Main Objects: abulli Ebišu (Ebišu Gate); abulli Enlil (Enlil Gate); bītu (house); harru (canal); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); pīhat Bābili (district of Babylon); pīhat Dilbat (district of Dilbat); ṭuppi šupêlti (tablet of the exchange); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms); zēru zaqpu mērešu u taptû (land planted with date palms, grain-cultivated and newly cleared land); zēru zaqpu u pî šulpi (land planted with palm trees and grain)
Comments: The tablet is a complex exchange document. See the paraphrase in NaBuCCo.
Author: Maarja Seire (19/01/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu peṣû (white silver)
Comments: Records silver payments from various individuals. Receiving party is not explicitly mentioned. Two witnesses, no scribe.
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); miksu (customs dues); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Comments: No explicit mention of a scribe. The document is somewhat between the legal and administrative document type.
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: agru (hireling); šādidu (boat tower)
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: ilku (corvée); unāt qašti (fitting of the archer)
Comments: Problematic object mentioned in line 1: ilki ṭīpi ša GIM unāt qašti. See Abraham 2004, p. 244.
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: (without specification); bāru; eleppu (boat); GIŠ.ŠID (register)
Comments: This interpretation differs slightly from Abraham 2004, p. 244: Rēmūtu and Libluṭ probably need to perform a service obligation involving boats under supervision of the Governor of Babylon.
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); idū (rent); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); kurummatu (ration)
Comments: Cf. Wunsch 2000a, note 339.
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: receipt

agru (hireling); dannu (vat); eleppu (boat); giṭṭu (receipt); haliptu (cable); idū (rent); kaspu peṣû (white silver); kunukku (sealed tablet); kurummatu (ration); qēmu (flour); šādidu (boat tower); šikaru (beer); šīmu (price); TÚG.KUR.RA (garment); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: List of expenditures for various activities connected to boat transports to Susa, under the authority of the Governor (of Babylon).
Author: Maarja Seire (23/01/2018)

Main Objects: akalu (usufruct); amēlūtu (slaves); bītu (house); broken/unclear; harrānu (business venture); karû (property held in common by several persons); kaspu (silver); kirî gišimmarī (date palm grove); maškanu (pledge); mērešu (grain-cultivated land); nīš ili u šarri (oath); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); u’iltu (promissory note); zēru (arable land); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: The document is about the allocation of inheritance shares between Nabû-ahhē-iddin's 3 sons, his business partner and his wife. The role of the 'testator' is rather passive in this document - Nabû-ahhē-iddin had died in c. Nbn 13. The inheritance consists of slaves, house, land and mentions many monetary transactions. See NaBuCCo for the paraphrase.
Author: Maarja Seire (26/01/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 31959+ (Wunsch 2000b, no. 10A).
Author: Maarja Seire (26/01/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); dannu (vat); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); šikaru (beer); šīmu (price); suluppū (dates)
Comments: List of expenditures of silver.

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Abraham 2004, 55 = BM 31667 + BM 31641. This is a receipt, the sale is recorded in BM 30370 (Abraham 2004, no. 11).

Main Objects: akalu (bread/food); Bēl; ērib bītūtu (prebend of the temple enterer); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); Nabû; šaṭāru ša adanni (record of obligation); šikaru (beer); suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: Promise under oath to settle debt of silver, barley and dates.

Main Objects: gimru (transport expenses); suluppū (dates)
Comments: Marduk-nāṣir-apli pays gimru by order of Gūzānu, governor of Babylon. The amount and what is paid is not specified, but it is for transportation of dates.

Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge)
Comments: It is actually a transfer of debt from Šulāya to his brother Nabû-ēṭir.
Author: Ivo Martins (02/03/2018)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: arhu (cow); kaspu (silver); kirû (orchard); maškanu (pledge); tarbaṣu (cattle pen)
Comments: Dialogue document.
Author: Ivo Martins (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: atānu (donkey mare); enzu (goat); gizzatu (shorn wool); immertu (ewe); immeru (sheep); kaspu (silver); mūru (donkey foal); mūštu (female donkey foal); parratu (female lamb); parru (lamb); šārtu (wool/hair); ṣēnu (small livestock); šipātu (wool)
Author: Julia Giessler (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: (without specification); biblu (bride price); kaspu (silver); nudunnû (dowry); šukuttu (jewellery); ṭuppu ša nudunnê (dowry record); udê bīti (household utensils)
Comments: So far the only attestation for the bestowal of a gift (biblu) upon the bride by the groom or his family respectively in a Babylonian milieu.
Author: Julia Giessler (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); bīt kišubbî (empty house plot); kaspu (silver); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); kirû (orchard); mūtaq ilāni u šarri (thoroughfare of the god and the king); šīmu (price); sūqu rapšu (wide street); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Author: Ivo Martins (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: tahsistu lā mašê (memorandum); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: Two memoranda (about promissory notes with interest) on one tablet.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); qaqqaru (plot of land); uṭṭatu (barley); zēru (arable land)
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: bāb kalakki (gate of the warehouse); hubullu (interest); tibnu (straw)
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: dannu (vat); kaspu qallalu ša ginnu erbu ša aranni (silver in small pieces, stamped, income of the treasury)
Author: Julia Giessler (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; hīṭu (punishment); Nabû; not applicable
Comments: Ahu-līt swears not to leave Sippar without permission of Marduk-rēmanni; otherwise he will suffer the punishment of the satrap of Babylon and Across-the-River.
Author: Julia Giessler (02/03/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); harrānu (business venture); kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu lā ginnu (white scrap unstamped silver with 1/8 alloy); Šamaš; Sîn
Author: Melanie Groß (04/03/2018)

Main Objects: alpu (cattle); kaspu ginnu (stamped silver); kaspu qalû (refined silver)
Author: Julia Giessler (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); harrānu (business venture); idū (rent); karû (property held in common); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu ginnu (stamped silver)
Author: Julia Giessler (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: immeru (sheep); maddattu (rent, compensation); šaṭāru (record)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: uṭṭatu (barley); uzbarra ša šarri (crown land); zēru (arable land)
Comments: Dialogue document.
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: alpu (bull, ox); bīt ritti (type of land); dullu (work); uṭṭatu (barley); zēru (arable land)
Comments: Dialogue document.
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: etēqu (expenses); harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); utru (profit)
Comments: All witnesses whose names are preserved are relatives of the main business partners.
Author: Julia Giessler (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: mû (water); šaṭāru (record); ṣibittu (pond); sūtu (fixed rent); uṭṭatu (barley); uzbarra (crown land); zēru (arable land)
Comments: Dialogue document.
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: bābu (sluice); kunāšu (emmer); nāru (canal, river)
Comments: Dialogue document.
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: alpu (bull, ox); bīt qašti (bow land); bīt ritti (type of land); ikkaru (plough man); kunāšu (emmer); sūtu (fixed rent); uṭṭatu (barley); zēru (arable land); zittu (share)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu ginnu bitqu (stamped silver with 1/8 alloy)
Author: Julia Giessler (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu ginnu (stamped silver); kaspu qalû (refined silver)
Comments: The payment of the silver is attested in BM 92734 (OLA 233, no. 32), where it is specified as peṣû (white) and ginnu (stamped).
Author: Julia Giessler (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: alpu ummānu (mature ox); bābu (sluice); immeru (sheep); kibtu (wheat); maddattu (rent, compensation); mû (water); nāru (canal, river); sahlû (cress); šamaššammū (sesame); šambaliltu (fenugreek); šilihtu (part of canal); unūtu (utensils); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: bābu (sluice); kibtu (wheat); kunāšu (emmer); mû (water); nāru (canal, river); šilihtu (part of canal); uṭṭatu (barley); uzbarra ša šarri (crown land)
Comments: Duplicate CBM 5416 = BE 9 67.
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: nāru (canal, river); šamaškillu (onion)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: eqlu (field); palāh šarri (royal service); suluppū (dates); uṭṭatu (barley); zēru (arable land)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: qaštu (bow land); šaṭāru (record)
Comments: Mention of place names and land units suggest these are being (sub-)leased.
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy)
Author: Julia Giessler (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: bīt šadî (east wing); bīt sūti (south wing); bītu (house); eršu (bed); kaspu (silver); kāsu (cup, goblet); kurummatu (ration); kussû (chair); maškanu (pledge); mušahhinu (cooking vessel); not applicable; paššūru (table); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); u’iltu (promissory note); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: The text concerns Tappašar's share of the inheritance of her husband, Gimillu, which she will receive from Gimillu's heir, Iddin-Nabû, once he received the silver from Bēl-aplu-iddin. The text also includes an oath sworn to Ištar of Babylon by Tappašar concerning items of her husband that are at her disposal (cf. VAT 118).
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; dibbu (dispute)
Comments: The same scribe wrote BM 61185 (Waerzeggers 2014, no. 48) - both texts display a number of writing errors.
Author: Julia Giessler (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); kurummatu (ration); u’iltu (promissory note); udû (utensil)
Comments: A small star is drawn on the left edge of the tablet. Tappašar swore that she did not take utensils.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: ebūru (harvest); suluppū (dates)
Author: Julia Giessler (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu ginnu (stamped silver); peṣû (white); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Aramaic inscription (u.e. 17): mrdk (abbreviation of Marduk-rēmanni). The previous debt note that is mentioned in l. 5 is OLA 233 no. 27 (BM 79641).
Author: Julia Giessler (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; dayyānu (judge); Nabû; not applicable; ṣēnu (small livestock)
Author: Julia Giessler (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: arānu (chest); baṭû (platter); eršu (bed); eršu musukkannu (bed of Magan-wood); erû (lower grinding stone); gangannu (pot stand); hābibu (a vessel); huttu (storage vessel); kāsu (cup, goblet); kussû (chair); littu (stool); mukarrisu (oil-bowl); mušahhinu (cooking vessel); namharu (collecting vat); namzītu (fermenting vat); narkabu (upper grinding stone); šāšītu (a part of a lantern); šupāl šēpī (footstool); udû (utensil)
Comments: The tablet lists household goods of Gimillu.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: alpu ša epinni (plough ox); kurummatu (ration); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Julia Giessler (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: suluppū (dates)
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: asnû (dates); ebūru (harvest); kaspu (silver); kurummatu (ration); nudunnû (dowry); sahlû (cress); šamaššammū (sesame); šapû (jar?); šaṭāru (record); šipātu (wool); ṭabtu (salt); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: Agreement concerning the payment of the yearly rations of Tappašar and Gimillu. This arrangement was probably created because Gimillu was ill and incapable to take care of his own affairs.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (06/03/2018)

Main Objects: (without specification); kaspu (silver); nudunnû (dowry); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: Tablet shows characteristics of a school text.
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The layout is different in the duplicate; it is possible that the summary remark "and all the ērib-bītis of Šamaš" was inserted in the end of line 8, as suggested in the parallel text BM 74625 (OLA 233 no. 38a lines 8, 12) with duplicate BM 64296 (lines 7, 12), but there seems too little space.
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: suluppū (dates)
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: bīt ištāni (north wing); bītu (house); hubullu (interest); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); kinnayyātu (type of offering); maškanu (pledge); nudunnû (dowry)
Comments: The document concerns arrangements to repay two separate debts for which the same house was pledged (Nabû-šumu-līšir pledged a house to Bēl-ahhē-iddin, who pledged that same house to Nabû-bān-zēri for a period of two years).
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: see duplicate BM 61744 (Waerzeggers 2014, no. 37a) for contents; the layout of both texts differs slightly.
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The layout differs only slightly from the duplicate. The other promissory note mentioned in lines 11-12 is BM 61744 (OLA 233 no. 37a).
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See duplicate BM 74625 (Waerzeggers 2014, no. 38a) for contents; also the layout is nearly the same.
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy)
Comments: This promissory note is mentioned in BM 74474 = Waerzeggers 2014, no. 65 (lines 6-7).
Author: Julia Giessler (07/03/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; kaspu (silver); Nabû; rašûtu (credit); u’iltu (promissory note); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: The tablet shows typical features of writing exercise.
Author: Julia Giessler (08/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy)
Author: Julia Giessler (08/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu ginnu (stamped silver); kaspu qalû (refined silver)
Author: Julia Giessler (08/03/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); bīt Ninurta (temple of Ninurta); eqlu (field); erṣet bīt Ninurta (district of the Ninurta Temple); kaspu (silver); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); kirî gišimmarī zaqpu (planted date palm grove); šīmu (price); sūqu (street); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Author: Ivo Martins (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; hubullu (interest); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); maškanu (pledge); qaqqadu (capital); šīmu (price); suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note); unspecified prebend; zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms)
Comments: The reverse is slightly broken. Partial repayment of a debt of silver, dates, barley, and other produce (broken context). A prebend is mentioned, either a purchase of it or pledge of it.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: immeru (sheep); kaspu (silver)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: kanšu; kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); qaštu (bow tax); sīdu ša našparti; urāšu (corvée)
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qaštu (bow tax)
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; idū (wages); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); maškanu (pledge)
Comments: The beginning of the text is broken. The debtors seem to be Bēl-šumu-iškun and his brothers. They were probably mentioned at the beginning of the text. The text seems to concern the same debt as VAT 145 and VAT 2073. Baker 2004.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; Nabû; u’iltu (promissory note); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: This text was included in M. Jursa's study of the archive of Bēl-rēmanni (1999), but technically the tablet belongs to the archive of Marduk-rēmanni on account of its museum context.
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: bītu (house); hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); mimma gabbu maškanu (pledge of everything sb owns)
Comments: The text seems to concern the same debt as VAT 1961+1965+2069 and VAT 2073.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy)
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); idū (rent); kaspu peṣû nuhhutu (white scrap silver); qēmu (flour)
Comments: The tablet is fairly broken, a part of obverse is broken off and some of the witnesses are missing.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; imēru (donkey); kaspu (silver); Nabû; nikkassu (account); ṣēnu (small livestock); šipātu (wool); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Oath concerning a payment and the drawing up of several accounts.
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); rašûtu (credit)
Comments: The second half of the text is largely damaged. It seems to concern the same debt as in VAT 1961+1965+2069 and VAT 145.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; kaspu ginnu ša nadāni u mahāri (stamped silver for trading)
Comments: The tablet is fairly broken. The document mentions a previous debt that has been paid.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: biriti lā aṣîti (blind alley); bītu (house); bītu epšu sippu raksu (built house with doorframes in place); bītu ruggubu (roofed house); daltu (door); erṣet Eanna (district of Eanna); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); mūtaq ilāni u šarri (thoroughfare of the god and the king); sikkūru (lock); šīmu (price); sūqu rapšu (wide street); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Author: Ivo Martins (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: List of barley disbursements.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: rašûtu (credit)
Comments: The scribe is not mentioned.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: burtu (heifer); šipirtu (letter order; message)
Comments: Only five lines are preserved on the obverse, the rest of the obverse is broken off.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu nuhhutu (scrap silver); not applicable; tahsistu lā mašê (memorandum)
Comments: Text summarized as a memorandum (line 16: tahsistu lā mašê); a scribe is not mentioned. One man guarantees another that a third will not go to another place; otherwise the guarantor will have to pay a fee in silver.
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: bāb kalakki (gate of the warehouse); qaqqadu (capital); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: It is uncertain whether this tablet belongs to the Nappāhu archive.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: adannu (deadline, term); gizzatu (shorn wool); imēru (donkey); nikkassu (account); not applicable; ṣēnu (small livestock); tamlittu (offspring); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The text is probably related to BM 78146 (Waerzeggers 2014, no. 46): the person who swore to come and draw up accounts shall now be fetched; the deadline mentioned here in line 15 might thus refer to the elapsed first day of month 10 of the 5th year of Darius (see BM 78146, line 5-6).
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); rašûtu (credit); šaṭāru (record)
Comments: Duplicate published in Abraham 2004, no. 128. The tablets are inscribed rather differently, although the scribes are said to be the same. There are also spelling differences between the two tablets. Cf. the comment in Abraham 2004, page 439.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 31977 (Abraham 2004, no. 65).   The tablets are inscribed rather differently, although the scribes are said to be the same. There are also spelling differences between the two tablets. Cf. the comment in Abraham 2004, p. 439.  The lower edge and the beginning of the reverse of this tablet (BM 31869) are broken (i.e. a part of the witness list).
Author: Maarja Seire (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: gišru (bridge); urāšu (corvée)
Comments: Payment (probably silver) received for (corvée) worker(s) of the bridge for more than 2 years.
Author: Julia Giessler (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: biriti lā aṣîti (blind alley); bītu (house); bītu epšu sippu raksu (built house with doorframes in place); bītu ruggubu (roofed house); daltu (door); erṣet Eanna (district of Eanna); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); mūtaq ilāni u šarri (thoroughfare of the god and the king); sikkūru (lock); šīmu (price); sūqu rapšu (wide street); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Author: Ivo Martins (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: Duplicate of AO 10347.
Author: Ivo Martins (09/03/2018)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The end of the obverse is fragmentary. The text seems to record a dispute concerning a promissory note.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); maškanu (pledge); nudunnû (dowry); zēru (arable land)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu ginnu bitqu (stamped silver with 1/8 alloy); nikkassu (account); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: A man pays his debts (including interest), a capital amount in silver to his creditor via a third man, while his creditor buys his slave woman for nearly the same amount of silver via this third man.
Author: Julia Giessler (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: ebūru (usufruct); hurāṣu (gold); kaspu (silver); mulūgu (dowry); qallu (slave); quppu (chest); šīmu (price); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms)
Comments: LB 1326 was formerly VAT 109.  The text refers to VAT 91//VAT 92.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Author: Julia Giessler (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: giṭṭu (receipt); qallu (slave); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: Traces of cuneiform signs and possible markings(?) on right edge.  The tablet documents an alteration to the gift promised in LB 1362.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: Bēl; gizzatu (shorn wool); imēru (donkey); Nabû; nikkassu (account); ṣēnu (small livestock); tamlittu (offspring); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Oath concerning bringing small cattle and drawing up accounts with Marduk-rēmanni according to a debt note of his dead father; the mentioning of summons in the end of this text (line 25) refers to BM 74661 (with duplicate BM 64220+). Note that in the catalogue of BRM 1 nos. 65 (belonging to the Egibi archive) AND 70 bear the museum no. MLC 1779.
Author: Julia Giessler (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu peṣû bitqu (white silver with 1/8 alloy); muṣīptu (garment); qaqqadu (capital); šīmu (price)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); muṣīptu (garment); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The document cancels the promissory note BM 77385, because the silver was never lent out.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: qallatu (female slave); ṣēnu (small livestock); tamlittu (offspring); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: No copy is available; compare the copy of the duplicate BM 64220+. The summons recorded here is also mentioned in MLC 1779 (line 25). Sîn-ahu-iddin is summoned to bring small cattle on the first day of month 9, in order to pay Marduk-rēmanni and act according to the debt note of Marduk-rēmanni's dead father.
Author: Julia Giessler (12/03/2018)

Subtype: promissory note; promissory note, with pledge
Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); maškanu (pledge); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See duplicate BM 74661 (OLA 233, 53a) for contents; the layout of both tablets is similar, see OLA 233, p. 230 for differences. This text shows features which may point to a writing exercise.
Author: Julia Giessler (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); kuruppu (warehouse or shop); maškanu (pledge)
Author: Julia Giessler (12/03/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu ginnu (stamped silver)
Author: Julia Giessler (13/03/2018)

Main Objects: alpu ummānu (mature ox); kibtu (wheat); unūtu (utensils); uṭṭatu (barley); zēru (arable land)
Comments: Aramaic epigraph (rev.): document of [PN? ...].

Author: Lidewij van de Peut (13/03/2018)

Main Objects: eqlu (field); imittu (assessed rent); kaspu (silver); suluppū (dates); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (13/03/2018)

Main Objects: rašûtu (credit); suluppū (dates)
Comments: The payment of dates is due from Bēlšunu according to a credit of Bēl-uballiṭ, but both are not acting. They rather seem to be represented by persons who might well be their sons, and who are represented by agents.

Main Objects: kurummatu (ration)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (13/03/2018)

Comments: Aramaic epigraph (u.e.; r.e.; lo.e.): document of PN creditor, who is paid, regarding year 33.

Comments: The document needed a lot of corrections because there are many strange spellings. Also the context is confusing at times. See Abraham 2004, p. 343f. If Bēl-rēṣûa does not register these dates into the accounts of Bēl-bullissu and his unnamed colleagues (a profession follows in plural, but it is broken), then Bēl-rēṣûa has to give the dates to the property of Nergal. The text is broken, but the name of Marduk-nāṣir-apli follows. Perhaps one should read: to the property of Nergal for the account of Marduk-nāṣir-apli.

Comments: Other documents concerning the same property are VAT 98, BM 77513, VAT 95, VAT 1941, VAT 129, MM 1031, VAT 131, and VAT 508+.    On the left and right edge 'seal of Libūru, scribe' is written below two sets of fingernail impressions which might belong to Lâbâši (see rev. 51f.). The tablet has, however, no seal impressions.

Comments: The document records the settlement of a debt of silver which was owed by Marduk-nāṣir-apli because he had sold a house to Anu-mukīn-apli (for 50 minas and 4 shekels of silver!) which was then seized by the Esangila temple. The document does not explain why. Marduk-nāṣir-apli paid Anu-mukīn-apli back the amount Anu-mukīn-apli had paid for the house of Marduk-nāṣir-apli, by giving him a field, a garden plot, 10 slaves, and an additional amount of silver. See the comment in Abraham 2004, pp. 346-347.
Author: Maarja Seire (30/04/2018)

Comments: The document records the sale of a slave. A part of the price is used to repay a debt of the sellers to their creditor. The slave that is now sold was pledged for this outstanding credit. The buyer gives the promissory note, which he apparently received from the creditor, back to them.     This manuscript is written in a larger ductus than the duplicate VAT 146.

Comments: The document records a payment of barley on the order of Ubāru who had given this barley to the payer Nabû-aplu-iddin. In addition, the document (u’iltu) recording the obligation of Nabû-aplu-iddin to register the barley on the writing board of Bēl and show (lit. give) it to Nabû-bullissu is mentioned and it is stated that the barley owed by PN (name lost) to Arad-Madānu has been paid.

Comments: The document records the gift of 3 slaves from a husband to his wife as partial compensation for gold and silver that he used from her dowry. As the remaining compensation she receives prebends as a security for the 10 minas of white silver that her husbands should give her. She can sell the pledged prebends for silver.
Author: Julia Giessler (09/05/2018)

Comments: Excavation no.: W.20032, 14. The document concerns a dispute between Mušēzib-Marduk and Bēl-ahhē-iddin about a prebend. Ahhēa had received the prebend from [Ammēni-ilī] and Bēl-ahhē-iddin acted as a guarantor. Mušēzib-Marduk sold the same prebend to Marduk and Nabû-ušallim for silver. The second half of the document is fragmentary.  Hunger 1970, pp. 221f. transliterated and translated the upper edge, but he omitted the upper edge in his copy of the tablet (ibid. p. 286).
Author: Ivo Martins (10/05/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy)
Comments: Earlier Iddin-Nabû/Pir’u//Nannûtu paid silver to Bēl-erība on behalf of Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu. This document records that Iddin-Nabû/Nabû-bān-zēri//Nappāhu paid that silver back to Iddin-Nabû/Pir’u//Nannûtu.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (14/05/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); unspecified prebend
Comments: Excavation no.: W.20032, 29.  Nabû-ušallim had received the prebend of Rāši-ili. The document records (in a dialogue style) the payment of silver by Nabû-ušallim for the prebend that he had received earlier from Rāši-ili. The silver is paid to the brother of the seller, Ibnāya. The document also contains a second quotation of Ibnāya's words which is largely lost.
Author: Ivo Martins (14/05/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)

Comments: The letter is Gūzānu's complaint about certain soldiers who were withheld from him by the commander of the citadel. He orders Širku to talk to Atkal-ana-mār-Esagil and find another group of soldiers for the commander of the citadel. Many anonymous groups of people are mentioned, such as the troops/workers of the gardu-workers, of mār banê, of Gūzānu, and from Bīt-Dakūru.
Author: Maarja Seire (16/05/2018)

Comments: This is probably a recipt, but the verb indicating this is broken. The onions are the share of Bagasarū, whose one slave receives them as proxy for another slave of Bagasarū, the treasurer.

Comments: This receipt records several actions (partially in direct speech) and a bond. A debt of silver has been paid back through two proxies (the brother of the debtor and the brother of the creditor), but without handing over the original debt note. The brother of the creditor is now obliged to bring any record of the meanwhile paid debt to the brother of the debtor.     Note that every time when the silver is mentioned, different designations are used.
Author: Maarja Seire (20/05/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu ša ginnu ša nadāni u mahāri (stamped silver for trading); kutallūtu (obligation to serve as a reservist); qaštu (bow tax)
Comments: The tablet records a payment on the account of the bow of Bēl-iddin. The silver is paid instead of serving as a reservist in the army. There are two payers and two recipients - one of each is a subordinate to another individual, which makes it possible that they represent their master/supervisor in paying and receiving money.    The document is damaged at the end of the obverse and the beginning of the reverse. Therefore, many roles remain unclear.     Note that there are three Iddināyas - two or three of them could be the same person.
Author: Maarja Seire (05/06/2018)

Main Objects: Ebabbar bīt Šamaš (temple of Šamaš in Sippar); huṣābu (rib of palm frond); kunāšu (emmer); manzaltu (service period); muhhuru-offering; nuhatimmūtu (baker’s prebend); pappasu (prebendary income); qēmu pahīdu (type of flour); qerrebu (offering); sattukku (type of offering); suluppū (dates); uppunutu (type of flour); uṭṭatu (barley)

Author: Julia Giessler (11/06/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: The document prescribes that Zēria has to give Nabû-aplu-iddin all the promissory notes documenting debts of Nabû-aplu-iddin to Zēria. He needs to do this because Nabû-aplu-iddin gave Ea-iddin and Ner[gal-...] that what Zēria owed them. As a consequence Nabû-aplu-iddin no longer owes any silver, barley, or dates to Zēria.    The drawing on the left edge is similar to the drawing on the reverse of MMA 86.11.207 (CTMMA 3, 13).
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (11/06/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Comments: Multiple payments are listed in this fragmentary document.

Comments: According to Spar and von Dassow 2000 (CTMMA 3), pp. 47f. the document records the receipt of goods by the temple from Nabû-aplu-iddin. However, Nabû-aplu-iddin's role is unclear. He might function as a witness (van Driel) or the document could record the disbursement of goods to Nabû-aplu-iddin. Besides Nabû-aplu-iddin, an official seems to be mentioned in obv. 2: šá {{lú}}ŠU PA A PI{{?}}.

Comments: Fragmentary. The assignment to Esagilāya B follows Van Driel. Spar and von Dassow 2000 (CTMMA 3), p. 221 suggest it may belong to this archive. But note that they list this text as possibly belonging to Esagilāya A on ibid. p. 27 n. 1. Van Driel thinks that Lâbâši son of Balāṭu is mentioned in the text.  Captions of four seal impressions are preserved, but there are no seal impressions. Hence, the tablet is a copy of a sealed original (see CTMMA 3, p. 221).
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (25/06/2018)

Author: Lidewij van de Peut (25/06/2018)

Main Objects: bīt dīni (courthouse); eqlu (field); hubullu (interest); kaspu babbanû (silver of good quality); Marduk; other; šīmu (price)
Comments: The document records the obligation of Iqīšāya and Nabû-zēru-ušebši to bring silver and Līšir/Marduk-ušallim//Rē’i-sisê to the judges in the courthouse.  The assignment to Esagilāya B is not certain. One of the main actors in the text is Ea-šumu-uṣur, the brother of Balāṭu who is the father of Lâbâši, the archive holder of Esagilāya B.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (25/06/2018)

Comments: Jursa 1999, p. 250 only gives an edition of the text and no copy of the tablet.   The assignment to the Šangû-Šamaš A archive is uncertain. According to Jursa it does not belong to this archive. The text is included as part of the Šangû-Šamaš A archive because Bēl-rēmanni/Mušebši-Marduk//Šangû-Šamaš is listed as the first witness.
Author: Julia Giessler (03/07/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; eqlu (field); hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); zēru (arable land)
Comments: This fragmentary document seems to record the payment of a debt, for which Balāṭu has pledged a field, by Nabû-šumu-iddin to [...]-bān-apli, and the usufruct of the pledged field being handed over to Nabû-šumu-iddin for 5 years. The text is assigned to Esagilāya B because Balāṭu might be Balāṭu/Ina-tēšî-ēṭir//Esagilāya and because Nabû-šumu-iddin/Iqīšāya//Nūr-Sîn also occurs in another text from Esagilāya B as a witness (MMA 86.11.307), see CTMMA 3, p. 54.

Comments: The text records (in direct speech) an assignment of slaves and further goods as compensation for a dowry. First the father of the bride complains that the dowry given by him has been partly seized by the creditors of the groom's father. Comments: Fragmentary.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (04/07/2018)

Main Objects: arānu (chest); imittu (assessed rent); immeru (sheep); kaspu (silver); kinnayyātu (type of offering); qaštu (bow tax); šikaru rēštû (first-draft beer); šīmu (price); suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note); zēru (arable land); zittu (share)
Comments: This promissory note contains a lengthy addendum documenting the background of the debt: the dates are due as equivalent for silver that was owed by the debtor and two other men for bow-service, stolen silver, beer, small-livestock and the kinnayyātu-offering. There is also a reference to a debt that the two debtors (Nidinti-Marduk and Inbāya) have with Bēl-rēmanni (in an elat-clause). After the witness list, there is another addendum referring to previous debts of the guarantor (Bēl-rēmanni) and one of the witnesses. The upper and left edge contain an additional remark that the debtors need to pay according to the current rate of exchange of silver if they do not pay in month VIII.
Author: Julia Giessler (04/07/2018)

Main Objects: suluppū (dates)

Comments: A woman transfers all her property to her daughter (except for silver and goods that she already gave as a dowry). There are additional clauses that state that the mother will still benefit from the usufruct of her assets, and that the daughter shall not transfer any property on her own authority. The text ends with a curse formula against anybody who violates this agreement.

Main Objects: \N
Comments: This fragmentary document contains a declaration that the son of Šulāya made to Lâbâši concerning a promissory note recording a debt of dates. The Assignment to the Esagilāya B archive follows Van Driel.  Van Driel suggests to read Bulluṭu{{??}} son of(?)  Šumu-libši somewhere in obv. 5-6. Van Driel furthermore suggests that the obverse and reverse are inverted, because the list of people in obv. 3-6 is reminiscent of a witness list. This would explain the verb form attadin at the end of obv. 2, since that would then be the end of the statement made by the son of Šulāya to Lâbâši. The date at the end of the reverse would then be part of the declaration as well, and the date on the lower edge may have been the date when the tablet was written. However, the first line of the obverse would then begin with [A]-šú šá, which does not make much sense. Therefore, we have maintained the line numbering of Strassmaier's copy.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (13/07/2018)

Lâbâši/Balāṭu//Esagilāya, one of the archive holders of the Esagilāya B Archive, is mentioned as one of the witnesses, cf. Spar and Von Dassow 2000 (CTMMA 3), p. 27 n. 3.

Comments: This tablet and its duplicate are sealed on the top of the reverse (top, left and top, middle) as well as on all edges (line numbering follows the publication). This text was sealed by the adopter, while the duplicate was sealed by the parent, who gave the children into adoption. The reverse of this tablet is damaged, but well preserved on the duplicate, so that date, place and witnesses could be restored. The obverse of the duplicate is not as well preserved as on this tablet.
Author: Julia Giessler (30/07/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: The copy of this tablet is erroneously labeled U. 17238, 13, which is in fact the excavation number of UET 4, 187. The list of tablets in this publication renders the excavation numbers correctly (see UET 4, p. 68).    See duplicate for contents. The obverse of the text is much better preserved in the duplicate, while the reverse is much better preserved on this tablet.

This tablet is said to be sealed, but no impressions are visible (according to the copy) The original might also have fingernail marks: Sîn-balāssu-iqbi is said to have left nail marks instead of a seal (l. rev. 49). The seal impressions are mentioned on all other edges of the tablet (line numbering follows the publication).

Comments: A jointly held field at the Harru-ina-ahi-Ur that was leased to Ahūšunu/Šamaš-iddin is now leased for four years to Sîn-iddin/Sîn-ahhē-šullim.    The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, left, and right edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no impressions. The land leased here is the same as in UET 4, 41 and also the protagonists are to a large extent the same.

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Comments: The subtype 'partnership-related' follows NaBuCCo and San Nicolò and Ungnad 1929-1935. The roles 'business partner' has been assigned accordingly to all men in the body of the text. Pir’u seems to withdraw (nasāhu, written with the unusual spelling ˹na˺-is-˹hu˺) his investment from the jointly owned silver, or perhaps the business partners transferred the jointly owned silver to Pir’u. The body of the text is separated from the witness list by a ruling.

Comments: Nergal-iddin initiated litigations against Nabû-uṣur and Šumāya about a boat. It was decided that Nabû-uṣur and Šumāya have to pay an amount of silver, which they have paid to Nergal-iddin. In return Nergal-iddin gave them a (sealed) document.

Comments: This unpublished tablet can possibly be attributed to a subgroup (Nidintu/Bēl-ahhē-iddin//Bēl-eṭēri) of the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (21/08/2018)

Main Objects: ardu (slave)
Comments: Former museum no. Sp 3, 193. This fragmentary document uses formulae typical for a gift ([pāni] šudgulu). Even though not phrased as such, it could also have been a sale or an exchange. In this case a counter-gift/payment would be mentioned, but this is not preserved
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (13/08/2018)

Main Objects: ahu (half); eqlu zaqpu (field planted with palm trees); kaspu (silver); maddattu (rent, compensation); ugāru (meadowland); zēru (arable land); zittu (share)
Comments: Kuṣurea/Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ, Ana-pêa/Sîn-iddin and Šūzubu/Nūh-ilāni lease their shares in a field at the Harru-ina-ahi-Ur for four years.  The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, lower, and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions, while the nail mark of the lessee Sîn-abu-uṣur is visible.
Author: Julia Giessler (13/08/2018)

Main Objects: allāku (corvée performer, courier); bāru; idū (wages); irbu (income); kaspu qalû (refined silver); ṣidītu (travel provisions); širkū (temple oblates)
Comments: Kuṣurea/Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ hires Kidin-Nabû/Šumāya to go to Susa. He shall deliver the royal tax of year 6 on behalf of Kuṣurea.   The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions, while the nail mark of Zakîtu is clearly visible.  For contents of this text cf. also U. 17243, 22 (UET 4, 49), in which another man is hired by Kuṣurea for the same task.
Author: Julia Giessler (13/08/2018)

Main Objects: biltu ša huṣābi (load of palm-frond ribs); bītu (house); ebūru (harvest); eqlu (field); gipû ša uhinni (basket of green dates); gišimmaru (date palm grove); gugallu (tax payable to the gugallu); imittu (assessed rent); mangāgu (date palm fibres); mašīhu ša šarri (measure of the king); maškanu (pledge); suluppū (dates); tuhallu (palm-leaf basket)
Comments: The obverse of the tablet is damaged.     This unpublished BM 94507 tablet from the 1901-10-12 collection, can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.

Main Objects: ebūru (harvest); eqlu (field); gišimmaru (date palm grove); gugallu (tax payable to the gugallu); imittu (assessed rent); suluppū (dates); tamirtu (irrigated farmland)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives. The last part of the obverse is very fragmentary. The lower edge and the beginning of the reverse are lost.

Comments: This tablet can be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bāni, Ilī-bāni and Nanāhu archives. Cf. TMH 2/3, 12 (Ššu 10) and TMH 2/3, 11 (Ššu 08).
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (13/08/2018)

Main Objects: hanšû (hanšû-land); kaspu peṣû (white silver); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); zittu (share)
Comments: This tablet can be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bāni, Ilī-bāni and Nanāhu archives. Cf. TCL 12, 9 (Ššu 07) and TMH 2/3, 12 (Ššu 10).  The document records the receipt of white silver which is the price paid by Zākiru and Bābilāya, both members of the Iddin-Papsukkal family, for their purchase of Nabû-ahu-ēreš//Ilūtu-bānī's share in hanšu-land. The publication TMH 2/3 gives as museum no. HS 455 for TMH 2/3 11 in the inventory list, but HS 555 next to the copy. HS 555 is TMH 2/3 111.

Main Objects: allāku (corvée performer, courier); bāru; idū (wages); irbu (income); kaspu qalû (refined silver); ṣidītu (travel provisions); širkū (temple oblates)
Comments: Kuṣurea/Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ hires Ātanah-Ištar/[Nūh-Ištar]. He shall go to Susa and deliver this year's royal tax of the oblates on behalf of Kuṣurea. Cf. UET 4, 48, in which another man is hired by Kuṣurea to fulfill the same task.  The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions. Also nail marks (of Nūh-Ištar?) should be on the reverse (according to the caption following line 24), but are not visible in the copy.
Author: Julia Giessler (15/08/2018)

Main Objects: abulli ṣīt Šamši (East Gate); bīt qašti (bow land); bītu (house); eqlu (field); eqlu gišimmaru zaqpu (field planted with date palms); kirî gišimmarī zaqpu (planted date palm grove); makkūru (treasury, estate); mūṣû (exit street); mūtaq nišī (thoroughway of the people); šaṭāru (record); Sîn; sūqu qatnu (narrow street); ṭuppi zitti (inheritance document); ṭuppu (tablet, record); ugāru (meadowland); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: Nidinti-Sîn and his brothers Sîn-iddin and Sîn-balāssu-iqbi/Sîn-ahhē-iddin//Gallābu divide their inheritance. This text is badly damaged: about half of the first 10 lines, and the last ca. 15 lines of the obverse are broken. The share of the second heir is described in the broken lines (22ff.).  The same estate is probably described in UET 4, 52.   The tablet is said to be sealed on the left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions.
Author: Julia Giessler (20/08/2018)

Comments: Three brothers, sons of Kabtia, used silver of Iddin-Nabû and Šamaš-šumu-līšir for their expenses. This document records their obligation to collect debts for their father Kabtia and pay the silver with interest back to Iddin-Nabû and Šamaš-šumu-līšir. In addition, the documents records an oath sworn by Kabtia.

Tablet UET 4, 58 has nearly the same wording as this text, but is not an exact duplicate.  There might have been fingernail marks on the upper edge of this tablet, but the passage is broken. There are just traces of the caption left: ˹ṣu-p˺[ur] ˹{{I[d]}}˺3[0-it-tan-na?]

Tablet UET 4, 57 has nearly the same wording like this text, but is not an exact duplicate. In addition to slightly different formulary, they have slightly different witnesses.  There might have been fingernail marks on the upper edge of this tablet, but the passage is broken. There are just traces of the caption left: ˹ṣu-p˺[ur ...].

Comments: This is an agreement between Zēria and Nabû-ēṭir: when Zēria's slave Uqūpu leaves the house of Nabû-ēṭir (or perhaps when he is seen there; cf. Wunsch 1993b, p. 39), Nabû-ēṭir is obliged to give a daily amount of barley (Uqūpu's mandattu) to Zēria, and also return a promissory note, according to which Nabû-ēṭir took Uqūpu as pledge or bought him.

Main Objects: dunātu (cheese); enzu (goat); gīdu (sinews); gizzatu (shorn wool); himētu (ghee); ildu (offspring); immertu (ewe); immeru (sheep); lahru (ewe); lalû (male goat kid); mašku (skin, leather); maṣṣartu (duty, service; guarding); muttatu (dead animal); puhālu (ram); rē'itu (herding); šārat enzu (goat hair); šārtu (wool/hair); ṣēnu (small livestock); suddudu (caretaking); sūtu (fixed rent); unīqu (female (goat) kid)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (27/08/2018)

Main Objects: ardu (slave); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); maškanu (pledge); sirāšû (brewers); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu nuhhutu (scrap silver); qaqqadu (capital)
Comments: Fragmentary. Probably a promissory note.
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: kāri ša šarri (royal harbor); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: kāri ša šarri (royal harbor); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: bīt qašti (bow land); qaqqaru (plot of land); rašûtu (credit); ṣerru (snake); šibšu (agricultural tax); ugāru (meadowland); uṭṭatu (barley); zēru pî šulpi (grain-cultivated land)
Comments: The tablet is said to be sealed on the reverse, and on the upper, and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions.
Author: Julia Giessler (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu (silver); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); lipû nashapu (nashapu-fat); nishu (expenses, payment for workers); nūṭu (leather bag); šīr alpi (beef); šīru (meat)
Comments: This is a list of expenses made by Iddin-Marduk and Nabû-ušallim during the last two years. We assume that the two men are business partners; cf. Wunsch 1993b.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: šūmū (onions, garlic)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy)
Comments: The silver is invested in a business partnership of a third man. The last lines of the obverse and the first lines of the reverse are broken. The scribe is not mentioned. The upper edge is missing on the copy.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/uncertain
Author: Ivo Martins (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: allāku (corvée performer, courier); andēsu ša šarri (gathering of the king); isimmānu (travel provision, all equipment); kaspu (silver); ṣidītu (travel provisions); uqu (people)
Comments: This work contract is phrased like a dialogue: Nidinti-Sîn/Sîn-ahhē-iddin asks Kuṣurea/Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ to hand him out taxation silver and the usual travel provisions of an agent of the people of Ur, so that he can go to this year's muster of the king.   The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions. Also the fingernail marks of the guarantor are not visible in the copy.
Author: Julia Giessler (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: dannu (vat); kaspu (silver); kasû (mustard-seed); mīnu ('payment (by instalments?)'); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); šūmū (onions, garlic); zittu (share)
Comments: Part of the tablet is badly broken.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu (boat); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu ša kāri ša šarri (royal harbor due); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: abulli ṣīt Šamši (East Gate); ārittu (drain channels); bītu (house); bītu epšu (built house); dīnu (lawsuit); eqlu (field); iṣu biltu (fruit bearing tree); kamaru (ramp); kirî gišimmarī zaqpu (planted date palm grove); mūṣû (exit street); mūtaq nišī (thoroughway of the people); ragāmu (contestation); sūqu qatnu (narrow street); takpurtu (equalising payment); ṭuppi zitti (inheritance document); zēru pî šulpi (grain-cultivated land)
Comments: This is a re-division of inheritance: Ninazu-uballiṭ and his brothers Balāṭu, Sîn-ahhē-iddin, and Bulluṭu/Iqīšāya//Gallābu divided their shares in year 21 of Xerxes, but in year 13 of Artaxerxes (probably the current year), Ninazu-uballiṭ is asked by his brothers to rearrange the shares in the course of a lawsuit.   The tablet is said to be sealed on the lower edge, but the copy shows no seal impressions.
Author: Julia Giessler (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Comments: IM: six lines of the obverse are effaced, therefore the objects are lost and the type cannot be determined.
Author: Ivo Martins (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Comments: Fragmentary.
Author: Ivo Martins (28/08/2018)

Main Objects: bīt tarbāṣi (courtyard house); bītu (house); broken/unclear; idū (rent); karānu (wine, grapes); kaspu (silver); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); makkūru (treasury, estate); Nanāya
Author: Ivo Martins (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu ša kāri ša šarri (royal harbor due)
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); šūmū (onions, garlic); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and without interest
Main Objects: kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); mimma ša āli u ṣēri (pledge of all property); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Comments: About 3 lines are missing on the top part of the obverse. Too broken for translation
Author: Ivo Martins (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); šamaššammū (sesame)
Comments: The silver has been used for the business partnership of Iddin-Marduk.
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); littu (cow); qaqqadu (capital); šikittu (garden plot); šīmu (price); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Comments: The debtor has to pay the silver (the price of the cow) and the onions. He shall use his onion field to settle the debts. The silver is invested in a business partnership of Iddin-Marduk.
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); littu nīri (draught animal); maškanu (pledge); qaqqadu (capital); šikittu ša šūmi (garden plot with onions); šīmu (price)
Comments: The silver is the price of a draught animal (a cow) and her calf. A garden plot is pledged to the creditor. The scribe of this tablet wrote all family names without a preceding marker {{lú}} or {{I}}.
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: dīnu (lawsuit); ragāmu (contestation); zēru zaqpu u pî šulpi (land planted with palm trees and grain); zittu (share)
Comments: The brothers Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ and Sîn-ušallim abstain from a lawsuit against Nidinti-Sîn, after he denied their shares in a plot of land. The statements of the 3 litigants are witnessed by mār banê and a mukinnu-witness.  The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper edge and to bear fingernail marks on the left edge, but the copy shows neither seal impressions nor nail marks.
Author: Julia Giessler (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: alpu (bull, ox); harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); qaqqadu (capital); rēhu (remainder, outstanding obligation); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The silver is a remainder of the price of an ox. The document adds that the earlier promissory note for a sum of silver has been broken and invalid.  The silver is from a business partnership of Iddin-Marduk.
Author: Maarja Seire (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: ārittu (drain channels); dīnu (lawsuit); eqlu (field); gišimmar bilti (fruitbearing date palms); harrānu (street); kaspu (silver); mūṣû (exit street); ragāmu (contestation); ṭuppu (tablet, record); ugāru (meadowland)
Comments: About access rights to a partitioned garden and rights to certain trees.   The tablet is sealed on the upper edge (line numbering follows the publication). According to the caption, there should also be fingernail marks on the right edge, but the copy does not show any.
Author: Julia Giessler (29/08/2018)

Main Objects: broken/uncertain; broken/unclear; dannu (vat); guqqû (monthly offering); ḫâṭu (instalment (of payment)); kaspu (silver)
Comments: A third witness must have been mentioned in rev. 15.
Author: Ivo Martins (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: alpu (bull, ox); burtu (heifer); harrānu (business venture); immeru (sheep); kalūmu ((male) lamb); kaspu (silver); parratu (female lamb); šipātu (wool)
Comments: The duplicate differs a bit: names are spelled differently, other designations are used for animals etc. See Wunsch 1993b, p. 51 and the copy EvM 20, which marks the differences between the two documents.
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 30620 (Wunsch 1993b, no. 60A).
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: etēqu (market price); kaspu (silver); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); kaspu hamuštu (silver with 1/5 alloy); šīmu (price)
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: eleppu haruptu (by the earliest boat); harrānu (business venture); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); nūptu (additional gift/payment); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Comments: The onions have to be delivered by the earliest boat. The silver is connected to the harrānu-business. The amount of silver is 2 and 2/3 in this text, but 2 and 5/6 in the duplicate.
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 33067 (Wunsch 1993b, no. 63A).
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: etēqu (expenses); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); šūmū (onions, garlic); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); nuhhutu (nuhhutu-quality?); ša šibirtu ša ina 1 šiqlu bitqu (in pieces, with 1/8 alloy); šūmū (onions, garlic)
Comments: The silver is invested in the business of Iddin-Marduk.
Author: Maarja Seire (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Ivo Martins (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); našpartu (written order)
Author: Ivo Martins (30/08/2018)

Main Objects: nishu (expenses, payment for workers); ṭuppu (tablet, record); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Ivo Martins (31/08/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Author: Ivo Martins (31/08/2018)

Main Objects: dunātu (cheese); enzu (goat); gīdu (sinews); gizzatu (shorn wool); himētu (ghee); ildu (offspring); immertu (ewe); immeru (sheep); lahru (ewe); lalû (male goat kid); mašku (skin, leather); maṣṣartu (duty, service; guarding); muttatu (dead animal); puhālu (ram); rē'itu (herding); šārat enzu (goat hair); šārtu (wool/hair); ṣēnu (small livestock); ṣēnu pēṣu (white livestock); ṣēnu ṣalmu (black livestock); suddudu (caretaking); sūtu (fixed rent); unīqu (female (goat) kid); urīṣu (he-goat)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (31/08/2018)

Main Objects: dunātu (cheese); enzu (goat); gīdu (sinews); himētu (ghee); ildu (offspring); immertu (ewe); immeru (sheep); lahru (ewe); lalû (male goat kid); mašku (skin, leather); maṣṣartu (duty, service; guarding); muttatu (dead animal); puhālu (ram); rē'itu (herding); šārat enzu (goat hair); ṣēnu (small livestock); ṣēnu pēṣu (white livestock); ṣēnu ṣalmu (black livestock); suddudu (caretaking); sūtu (fixed rent); unīqu (female (goat) kid); urīṣu (he-goat)
Comments: Payment of wool for lease of sheep is not mentioned. Possibly, it has been forgotten - the payment of goat hair is only mentioned in the reiteration of contract by the lessor (the second part of the "dialogue").
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (31/08/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); bītu (house); eqlu (field); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); kišubbû (unbuilt land, fallow land); kunukku (sealed tablet); qaqqaru gišimmarī zaqpu (plot of land planted with date palms); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Comments: Sîn-zēru-līšir/Rēmūt-Gula//Etellu buys from the brothers Sîn-ubillu, Sîn-ušallim and Sîn-ahhē-iqīša/Sîn-zēru-iqīša a field, land and orchard at the Harru-ša-Bēl-iddin.
Author: Julia Giessler (03/09/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); idū (rent)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.    The right upper part of the obverse is broken off.  The last two lines on the reverse are partly broken.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (03/09/2018)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and without interest
Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); qaqqadu (capital)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (03/09/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); qaqqadu (capital)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (03/09/2018)

Main Objects: bāb kalakki (gate of the warehouse); biltu ša huṣābi (load of palm-frond ribs); gišimmaru (date palm); imittu (assessed rent); suluppū (dates); tuhallu (palm-leaf basket)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (03/09/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); eqlu (field); gišimmaru (date palm); kaspu qalû (refined silver); kirî gišimmarī (date palm grove); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Comments: Bunnānu/Šumāya//Sîn-iqīša buys from the brothers Balāṭu and Ninazu-ibni/Šumāya//Dābibī a field and orchard at the Hiltu canal in Qadiminnu.   The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, left, and lower edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions. A broken caption on the lower edge might refer to fingernail marks of a man (probably either one of the sellers or the buyer): ṣu-[pur] {{I}}[...]. Alternatively this caption might also refer to the seal of a female:  {{f}}[... DUMU.SAL šá] {{I}}[...].
Author: Julia Giessler (03/09/2018)

Main Objects: mašīhu ša šarri (measure of the king); suluppū (dates)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (03/09/2018)

Main Objects: huṭartu (slave mark); kaspu qalû (refined silver); qallatu (female slave); rittu (hand); šīmu (price); šumu (name)
Comments: Iddia/Sîn-iddin and two others sell their slave to Iddahu-Nabû (slave of Nargia).  The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, and left edge, and to have fingernail marks on the right edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows neither seal impressions nor nail marks.
Author: Julia Giessler (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives. Cf. van Driel 1992 BiOr 49, 40; Joannès 1989, note 12.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu qalû (refined silver); qallatu (female slave); rittu (hand); šīmu (price); šumu (name)
Comments: Eridu’ītu/Ištar?-šēzib sells her slave Rubuttu to Ninazu-uballiṭ/Sîn-bēlšunu.   The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions. Nail-marks are on the upper edge, but without captions.
Author: Julia Giessler (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: not applicable
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives. cf. TCL 13, 213
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: abulli Lugal-gìr-ra (Lugal-gìr-ra Gate); bīt simmilti (staircase); bītu (house); kirî gišimmarī zaqpu (planted date palm grove); mūṣû (exit street); ṭuppi šupêlti (tablet of the exchange); zēru pî šulpi (grain-cultivated land); zittu (share)
Comments: The brothers Balāṭu and Hašdāya/Passaku(?) exchange property: a house against a palm grove and land.  The tablet is sealed on the reverse (next to the Aramaic epigraphs), and, according to captions, also on the upper, left, and right edge (line numbering follows the publication). At least one seal caption is completely broken off (l.e. 7) as well as a part of the lower tablet. The tablet also has an Aramaic epigraph “Document of Balāṭu".
Author: Julia Giessler (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); nāru (canal, river); suluppū (dates)
Author: Maarja Seire (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: hanšû (hanšû-land); tamirtu (irrigated farmland); zittu (share)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.    Note on different shares in irrigated farmland that were not received or not given. Each time they are divided by a ruled line.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Maarja Seire (04/09/2018)

Main Objects: biltu ša huṣābi (load of palm-frond ribs); eqlu (field); gugallu (tax payable to the gugallu); imittu (assessed rent); mašīhu ša šarri (measure of the king); suluppū (dates)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: biltu ša huṣābi (load of palm-frond ribs); eqlu (field); gugallu (tax payable to the gugallu); imittu (assessed rent); nudunnû (dowry); rašûtu (credit); šissinnu (gardener’s remuneration); suluppū (dates); tuhallu (palm-leaf basket)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: bīt qašti (bow land); bīt šarri (royal estate, royal house); eqlu (field); palāh šarri (royal service); zittu (share)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: abulli ṣīt Šamši (East Gate); asurrû (foundation wall); bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); šaṭāru (record); šugarrû (type of payment); ūru (roof)
Comments: Ninazu-ibni (slave of Sîn-nādin-ahi) rents a house at the East gate near the Ihilitumma from Nidinti-Šamaš and some other man (text broken).
Author: Julia Giessler (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); suluppū (dates)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: bīt ritti (type of land); dullu dālûtu (the work of drawing water); eqlu (field); zēru pî šulpi (grain-cultivated land)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: dannu (vat); šikaru ṭābu (full-strength beer); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: abulli Lugal-gìr-ra (Lugal-gìr-ra Gate); bītu (house); dīnu (lawsuit); zittu (share)
Comments: The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, left and lower edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions.
Author: Julia Giessler (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); qaqqadu (capital)
Comments: This tablet can probably be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: adannu (deadline, term); suluppū (dates)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: bāru; qēmu (flour tax); qēmu (flour)
Author: Rieneke Sonnevelt (05/09/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); hubullu (interest); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); kaspu ša ina 1 šiqil girê (silver which has 1/12 alloy per shekel); šaṭāru (record)
Comments: The tablet is said to be sealed on the upper, and left edge (line numbering follows the publication), but the copy shows no seal impressions, while the nail mark on the reverse is clearly visible.
Author: Julia Giessler (06/09/2018)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; immeru (sheep); šīmu (price); suluppū (dates)
Author: Maarja Seire (06/09/2018)

Main Objects: bītu (house); hubullu (interest); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); kinnayyātu (type of offering); maškanu (pledge)
Comments: The debtor Bēl-šumu-iškun has pledged his house which is rented out to Nergal-iddin. The silver from the rent goes to the creditor Madānu-šumu-iddin, and some of it also goes to two other creditors, Iddin-Marduk and Nabû-zēru-ušebši. In addition, there is another person involved (line 8a), who might have been a creditor of Bēl-šumu-iškun as well, because he also took his house as a pledge.  Line numbering according to Ner. 24 (cf. Wunsch 1993b) - in the other copy (Liv 114) two lines are missing (l. 5; 8a).
Author: Maarja Seire (24/07/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); bīt kamari (house with a ramp); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); šīmu (price); sūqu qatnu (narrow street); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Comments: The sellers left their fingernail marks on the tablet, but they are not visible in the copy.
Author: Julia Giessler (06/09/2018)

Main Objects: harrānu (business venture); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy)
Author: Maarja Seire (06/09/2018)

Main Objects: batqu (damages, repair); bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); sūqu qatnu (narrow street); ūru (roof)
Comments: This renting contract is styled in the form of a dialogue. Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ/Hašdia//Gallābu is asked (and agrees) to rent out his house.  The tablet has fingernail markings without a caption on the lower edge.
Author: Julia Giessler (06/09/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); atûtu (doorkeeper’s prebend); bāb uqnî (Lapis lazuli Gate); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); kunukku (sealed tablet); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); zittu (share)
Comments: Sîn-iddin/Sîn-ahhē-bulliṭ//Gallābu buys nine months of the doorkeeper's prebend at the lapislazuli gate from Ahūšunu, who holds these nine months as a share together with (another?) Sîn-iddin.
Author: Julia Giessler (06/09/2018)

Main Objects: mušahhinu (cooking vessel); mušahhinu siparru (bronze cooking vessel); siparru (bronze)
Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.     There are illegible traces on the left edge of the tablet.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (11/09/2018)

Main Objects: adappu / dappu (horizontal crossbeam); broken/unclear; eqlu (field); hirûtu (excavation/digging work); igāru (wall); kaspu (silver); makallû (mooring place); mušannītu (dam); nār sūq šarri
Comments: At a land of Bānûnu in Bīt/Till-Qalūnu digging work needs to be done and a wall needs to be made (Wunsch 2000a, p. 62 fn. 142).
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (11/09/2018)

Main Objects: broken/uncertain; maškanu (pledge); zēru (arable land)
Author: Lidewij van de Peut (11/09/2018)

Comments: The copy of this tablet is erroneously labeled U. 17238, 12, which is in fact the excavation number of UET 4, 70. The list of tablets in this publication renders the excavation numbers correctly (see UET 4, p. 68).    Ērešu buys a planted date palm grove at the Harru-ša-āli in Ur from Kiribtu, whose three brothers own adjacent land.  The tablet is a copy - the fingernail imprints of the seller are not on it.
Author: Julia Giessler (11/09/2018)

Comments: This tablet can possibly be attributed to the Ea-ilūti-bānī, Ilī-bānī and Nanāhu archives.  The right lower corner of the obverse and the right upper corner of the reverse are broken off.   The last line of the obverse seems to be written over an erasure.   The end of the last line of the lower edge is broken. It probably states the beginning of the witness list with {{lú}}mukinnu. The family names of some witnesses are lost due to the break in the right upper corner of the reverse.   Between line 13 and 14 there are 2 lines blank.
Author: Evelien Vanderstraeten (12/09/2018)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); eqlu (field); gišimmaru (date palm); kirû (orchard); kišubbû (unbuilt land, fallow land); kunukku (sealed tablet); qaqqaru (plot of land); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); ugāru (meadowland); zēru pî šulpi (grain-cultivated land)

Comments: Marduk-zēru-ibni, son of Bēl-upahhir, and descendant of Eppēš-ilī is one of the principal protagonist of the Ea-Eppēš-ilī B archive. He is attested in this tablet as donor of land to his wife, daughter and daughter-in-law. The donation to his daughter-in-law is not a true gift but a compensation equivalent in value to her original dowry (kūm nudunnê).
