Author: Ivo Martins (13/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu ša ginnu ša nadāni u mahāri (stamped silver for trading); maškanu (pledge); mimma ša āli u ṣēri (pledge of all property); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Ivo Martins (14/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); riksu (contract); šīmu (price); širiktu (gift; votive offering)
Comments: Itti-Marduk-balāṭu had bought (previously pledged) slaves from Bēl-iddin. Later, Bēl-iddin and his mother Nidintu had paid back Itti-Marduk-balāṭu the price of two slaves Šannāya and Kubbuttu and ceded Tabluṭ. The slaves still remain with Itti-Marduk-balāṭu until another debt is settled between Itti-Marduk-balāṭu and Nabû-balāssu-iqbi (presumably a brother of Bēl-iddin).    The duplicate is published as Nbn 953.    Cf. Nbn 585 (BM 30521) and Nbn 602 (BM and aqcuisition number unknown).
Author: Maarja Seire (14/09/2020)

Main Objects: rašûtu (credit); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The document adds that the promissory note credited to Nabû-ṣābit-qātē against Rēmūt-Bēl and Šiddatu, wherever it may turn up, belongs to Rēmūt-Bēl and Šiddatu. Assignment to the Egibi archive uncertain, but Nabû-ahhē-iddin//Egibi is the scribe.
Author: Maarja Seire (14/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note; promissory note, with interest
Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The tablet is a clay cast made in the 19th century AD. The obverse and reverse are copies of different tablets. CTMMA 3, no. 129 deals with Side B (obverse), while Side A (reverse) is published in CTMMA 3, no. 77.
Author: Maarja Seire (14/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); qaqqadu (capital); suluppū (dates); utru (profit)
Comments: The beginning of the obverse and the end of the reverse are broken.
Author: Maarja Seire (14/09/2020)

Main Objects: bīt qašti (bow land); bīt sūti (rented property); ekallu (palace); ešertu (decury); imittu (assessed rent); makkūr šarri (crown land); suluppū (dates); šumu (name)
Comments: The tablet is damaged.
Author: Ivo Martins (15/09/2020)

Main Objects: ahu (half); ararrūtu (miller’s prebend); bīt qašti (bow land); bīt sūti (rented property); ebūru (harvest); imittu (assessed rent); kurummatu (ration); lē’û (register); makkūr šarri (crown land); šipirtu (letter order; message); suluppū (dates)
Author: Ivo Martins (16/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Comments: The interest is specified as 1 š minus 1/6 š per 1 mina (monthly).
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); ekallu (palace); kaspu (silver); rašûtu (credit); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The document relates to subrogation. Iqīšāya sold his house to the palace. Nabû-aplu-iddin owes him money for the sale. Nabû-ahhē-iddin pays a part of it to the creditor and the title to the debt is transferred to Nabû-ahhē-iddin.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note; promissory note, with pledge; promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: bītu (house); hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); nudunnû (dowry); qanû (plot of land); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note); zittu (share)
Comments: Gugûa sells dowry property without her sons (co-owners) being present. After this, she lends money to Tabnēa. It is not clear how Nabû-ahhē-iddin was involved or how the sons got compensated, as the text is fragmentary towards the end of the obverse.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); nudunnû (dowry); qallu (slave); šīmu (price)
Comments: The buyers Nergal-uballiṭ and Hiptāya sell the slave they bought to the royal courtier Nabû-ṣābit-qātē. However, they have not yet paid the full sum for the purchase to the original sellers, Etel-pî and Hanašu. Nabû-ahhē-iddin will pay the original sellers.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 31105 (Ner 7).
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and without interest
Main Objects: kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); mimma ša āli u ṣēri (pledge of all property); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Main Objects: bābu (entrance, door); bīt mār šarri (house of the crown prince); dušû (dyed leather; hide); niāru (parchment); nikkassu (account); ṣallu (type of leather)
Comments: The two obligors will lead the debtors to the house of the crown prince, where their accounts will be settled by Kīnāya.
Author: Maarja Seire (18/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; not applicable
Author: Maarja Seire (20/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver)
Comments: The two names after the date formula are probably witnesses, but no designation for the witnesses is used. Instead, they are preceded by the sign 'šá' ('of; who; which' etc).
Author: Maarja Seire (20/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Author: Maarja Seire (20/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); qallu (slave); šumu (name); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Fragmentary. The copy of the tablet was not available. The edition does not mark where the reverse begins.
Author: Maarja Seire (20/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); mâr banûtu (status of a citizen)
Author: Maarja Seire (20/09/2020)

Main Objects: arad-šarrūtu (royal servant/slave); kaspu (silver); mâr banûtu (status of a citizen); qallu (slave); šīmu (price)
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); uškûtu (ulterior claims)
Comments: The slaves were either taken away by Nabû-ahhē-iddin because of an unpaid debt or they were sold. Zēria then lodged a claim and took them away. He is the holder of prior claims, and not Nabû-ahhē-iddin.
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: ararru (mill); hašimuru (cumin); narkabu (upper grinding stone); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); nišū bīti (people of the household); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: If Nūptāya fails to pay by Nisan in the 4th year of Neriglissar, then Nādinu will record the price in a promissory note. By the same date, she also has to give the slaves to Nādinu, or give back the silver.
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/uncertain
Comments: The tablet is badly damaged, which makes the interpretation of the text difficult. Assignment to the Egibi archive uncertain.
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: alpu (bull, ox); amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); nudunnû (dowry); ṣēnu (small livestock); udê bīti (household utensils)
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver)
Comments: Assignment to the Egibi archive uncertain.
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Comments: Assignment to the Egibi archive uncertain.
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: (without specification); nudunnû (dowry); šaṭāru (record); ṭuppi zitti (inheritance document); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: Two brothers divide their inheritance from the dowry of their mother. Note that the brothers have different patronyms and family names, but they are referred to as brothers on two occasions. Cf. Camb 429; Tanret and Dekiere 1996, p. 163.
Author: Maarja Seire (21/09/2020)

Main Objects: biriti lā aṣîti (blind alley); bīt nudunnî (dowry estate); bītu (house); dibbu (dispute); gabrû (copy); mešhatu (measurement); mūṣû (exit street); qanû (plot of land); sūqu lā āṣû (dead-end street); sūqu qatnu āṣû (narrow through-street); takpurtu (equalising payment); ṭuppi zitti (inheritance document); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: The tablet records detailed measures of the property - the length of the plot, the streets around it and the neighbors.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: Bēl; immeru (sheep); kurummatu (ration); Nabû; qallu (slave)
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: akalu (bread/food); amēlūtu (slaves); bītu (house); hubullu (interest); idū (wages); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); maddattu (rent, compensation); maškanu (pledge); mimma ša āli u ṣēri (pledge of all property); muṣīptu (garment); qallu (slave); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Note that for 1/3 mina - out of the 1 1/3 minas of silver - interest has to be paid.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); rašûtu (credit)
Comments: The end of the obverse is broken, but it contains three elat-clauses.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The document records that if the silver for the bought slave(s) is not paid by 5th of Abu (month V), the buyer has to hand the slave(s) back to the seller.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: (without specification); kaspu (silver); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); šīmu (price)
Comments: Note that the witness list has some strange spellings in rev. 7 and 8, which need to be collated. The king's name is also strangely spelled.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: abulli Giššu (Giššu Gate); asurrû (foundation wall); bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); nūptu (additional gift/payment); ūru (roof)
Comments: Lease of house for 3 years.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: asurrû (foundation wall); bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); nūptu (additional gift/payment); ūru (roof)
Comments: Lease of house for 3 years.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Comments: BM website has acquisition number 76-11-17, 1709.  The end of the obverse and the beginning of the reverse are broken off.
Author: Maarja Seire (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Author: Ivo Martins (22/09/2020)

Main Objects: suluppū (dates)
Comments: The end of the obverse and the beginning of the reverse are broken off. The obverse is fragmentary and difficult to interpret.
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: bīt maškani (pledged property); eqlu (field); kaspu (silver); šikittu (onion field); suluppū (dates); šūmū (onions, garlic); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The tablet has a few weird spellings of the names and few lines on the edge are too damaged to read.
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: Bēl; bīt Šamaš (temple of Šamaš); bītu (house); kaspu hāṭu (silver 'in cash'); Nabû; Nergal; rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); šikaru (beer); suluppū (dates); tēlītu (expenditure)
Comments: Assignment to the Egibi archive uncertain.
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: eqlu zaqpu u pî šulpi (field planted with palm trees and grain); maškanu (pledge); rašûtu (credit); suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: ekallu (palace); kaspu (silver); rašûtu (credit); šīmu (price); suluppū (dates)
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); kutallu (reserve); maškanu (pledge); rikis qabli (outfitting); ṣidītu (travel provisions); suluppū (dates); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: The end of the obverse and the beginning of the reverse are broken. Some of the other lines are fragmentary.
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; eqlu (field); rašûtu (credit); rikis qabli (outfitting); suluppū (dates)
Comments: Some of the lines on the reverse are very fragmentary.
Author: Maarja Seire (25/09/2020)

Main Objects: qaqqadu (capital); suluppū (dates)
Author: Maarja Seire (26/09/2020)

Main Objects: nikkassu (account); uṭṭatu (barley)
Author: Maarja Seire (26/09/2020)

Main Objects: bīt maškani (pledged property); bītu (house); eqlu (field); ešrû (tithe); kaspu (silver); rašûtu (credit); suluppū (dates)
Comments: Some of the lines are fragmentary.
Author: Maarja Seire (26/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; harrānu (business venture); kaspu (silver); suluppū (dates)
Comments: The tablet is extremely fragmentary and difficult to interpret. In many lines, Itti-Marduk-balāṭu and Kalbāya are attested, but because there are more than one of both mentioned in this document, these lines are not included among the attestations below (i.e. it is not certain who is meant because of the broken context).
Author: Maarja Seire (26/09/2020)

Main Objects: abulli Giššu (Giššu Gate); asurrû (foundation wall); bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); ūru (roof)
Comments: The duration of the lease is not recorded. The tablet also mentions a debt in elat-clause.
Author: Maarja Seire (26/09/2020)

Main Objects: abulli Giššu (Giššu Gate); bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); nūptu (additional gift/payment); ūru (roof)
Comments: Lease of house for 3 years.
Author: Maarja Seire (27/09/2020)

Main Objects: akalu (bread/food); bīt maškani (pledged property); bītu (house); broken/unclear
Comments: The end of the obverse and the beginning of the reverse are broken off.
Author: Maarja Seire (27/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest)
Author: Maarja Seire (27/09/2020)

Main Objects: dayyānu (judge); dīnu (lawsuit); kaspu (silver); muquttû (claim for an amount due); purussû (decision); qallu (slave); riksu (contract); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: maškanu (pledge); Ninlil; sarāqu (to sprinkle); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: A woman needs to perform a ritual act before the goddess Ninlil; a man assumes warranty, and a pledge is given by two brothers. The relationship between the woman and these three men is not specified.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; kāṣir-lamhušsûtu (manufacture of lamhuššu-garments); kāṣirūtu (tailer’s craft); kusīpu (bread); muṣīptu (garment); šaṭāru (record)
Comments: Apprenticeship contract for 2 years and 3 months. Some of the lines are fragmentary.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: kaspu (silver); lamutānu (slave); maškanu (pledge); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: erû (lower grinding stone); haṣbātu (bowl); narkabu (upper grinding stone)
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Comments: Only one fragmentary line has been preserved on the obverse. The reverse is fragmentary as well. The tablet can be assigned to the Nūr-Sîn annex because of the ina ašābi witness Ina-Esagil-ramât, the wife of Iddin-Marduk//Nūr-Sîn.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu (silver); rikis qabli (outfitting)
Comments: The silver is of the house of Hašdāya, but also the contribution of Itti-Nabû-balāṭu's rikis qabli payment for year 3 and 4 of Cambyses.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear
Comments: The obverse is very fragmentary and the reverse is slightly fragmentary. The tablet could belong to the Nūr-Sîn annex of the Egibi archive.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: bītu (house); broken/unclear; hubullu (interest); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); sūqu Hubur (Hubur street)
Comments: Some of the lines on the obverse are fragmentary.
Author: Maarja Seire (28/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (29/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); qallu (slave); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Sale of a slave previously pledged by the seller. Note that the tablet appears under two different numbers in the edition by Strassmaier.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (29/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); parzillu (iron); šīmu (price); siparru (bronze)
Comments: Payment in silver for bronze and iron (objects).
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (29/09/2020)

Main Objects: imēru (donkey); kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Comments: Promissory note of the price of a donkey.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (30/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qallu (slave); šīmu (price)
Comments: Receipt of the price of a slave.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (30/09/2020)

Main Objects: eršu (bed); idū (wages); kaspu (silver); musukkannu (Magan-wood)
Comments: Nabû-ahhē-iddin provides a carpenter with wood and wages to manufacture a bed.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (01/10/2020)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); šīmu (price)
Comments: The silver is the price of a slave. Assignment to the Egibi Nūr Sîn archive because Nabû-ēṭir is often attested in that archive and on account of the museum collection.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (01/10/2020)

Main Objects: hurāṣu (gold); kaspu (silver)
Comments: The silver is paid for a purchase of gold.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (01/10/2020)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); bītu (house); bītu abtu (ruined house); broken/unclear; erṣet TE.E (district of TE.E); huṣṣu (reed hut); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); lubāru (garment); mahīru (market rate); qanû (plot of land); šīmu (price); sūqu qatnu lā āṣû (narrow no through-street); sūqu rapšu mūtaq Nergal ša hadê (wide thoroughfare street of Nergal of joy); tēlītu (expenditure)
Comments: Both Strassmaier and Bertin copy have only BM 32198. The tablet is fragmentary towards the end of the obverse and beginning of the reverse, including the witness list, is completely broken. Cf. Liv 18 (Liverpool 29-11-77, 14).
Author: Maarja Seire (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Comments: The object that was purchased is broken off. Several names of witnesses are also broken off.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: idū (wages); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); qallu (slave)
Comments: The names of the witnesses and scribe are broken off.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: hubuttūtu (interest free loan); kaspu (silver); qaqqadu (capital)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); bītu (house); broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Comments: The tablet is damaged towards the end of the obverse.
Author: Maarja Seire (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: immeru (sheep); iškaru (assignment); kaspu (silver); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); šaṭāru (record)
Author: Reinhard Pirngruber (09/09/2020)

Main Objects: broken/unclear; kaspu (silver); qallatu (female slave); šīmu (price); šumu (name)
Comments: The end of the obverse and the beginning of the reverse are broken. The name of the owner (seller Itti-Marduk-balāṭu) is written on the slave in cuneiform and alphabetic script (akkādîtu u ahlamāti).
Author: Maarja Seire (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); qallu (slave); rašûtu (credit); šīmu (price)
Comments: The debtors pay their pledged slave to Itti-Marduk-balāṭu who pays the owed silver directly to the creditor. See Camb 428 (BM 32925).
Author: Maarja Seire (02/10/2020)

Subtype: promissory note, with pledge and interest
Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); hubullu (interest); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); muṣīptu (garment); qallu (slave)
Comments: The tablet states that the slave is pledged and there will be no rent or interest on the debt. However, a few lines later it is stated that the interest rate is 20%.    See Camb 429 (BM 31569).
Author: Maarja Seire (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: idū (wages); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest)
Author: Reinhard Pirngruber (09/09/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qaštu (bow land); ṣāb šarri (payment or service of royal soldier); ṣidītu (travel provisions); tēlītu (expenditure)
Author: Reinhard Pirngruber (09/09/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); šīmu (price); uškûtu (ulterior claims)
Comments: The tablet describes the markings on slaves and their bodily features (e.g. birthmarks). See NaBuCCo for the description.
Author: Maarja Seire (02/10/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); šūmū (onions, garlic); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Maarja Seire (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: arānu (chest); eršu (bed); idū (rent); ingurēnu (lamp stand?); kankannu (pot stand); kussû (chair); marru parzillu (iron spade); maššānu (mng. unclear); mušahhinu (cooking vessel); namzītu (fermenting vat); paššūru (table); qulmû (axe); šiddatu (stand for a large vessel); sirpu (shears, clippers); u’iltu (promissory note); udû (utensil)
Comments: A list of items that Marduk-iqīšanni should give to Ishunnatu. At the end of the document it is mentioned that the promissory note of Lillikanu should be given to Ishunnatu as well.
Author: Maarja Seire (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: baṭû siparru (bronze platter); eršu (bed); haṣbātu (bowl); ingurēnu (lamp stand?); kankannu (pot stand); kaspu (silver); kasû (mustard-seed); kāsu siparru (bronze cup); kussû (chair); marru parzillu (iron spade); maššānu (mng. unclear); mušahhinu (cooking vessel); namzītu (fermenting vat); qulmû (axe); šiddatu (stand for a large vessel); šikaru ṭābu (full-strength beer); šīmu (price); sirpu (shears, clippers); suluppū (dates)
Comments: The tablet lists items that are deposited in a house. Ishunnatu has to pay interest on these items. In addition, more items are mentioned in the elat-clause (cf. Camb 330).
Author: Maarja Seire (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qallu (slave); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: An extra witness is added to the sale of a slave.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: adû (oath); kaspu (silver)
Comments: The duplicate is published as Nbn 199a.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 30354 (Nbn 199).
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: dannu (vat); kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Comments: Receipt of the price of 10 vats.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/10/2020)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver)
Comments: For the museum number, see Leichty, Finkel and Walker 2019, p. 51. The names of the witnesses are broken off.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (04/10/2020)

Main Objects: hurāṣu (gold); kaspu (silver); kišādu (necklace); mandītu (mounting); šīmu (price)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (04/10/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); šaṭāru (record); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The document is an annulment of a purchase of 3 slaves. The seller Habaṣīru has to send the messenger to Babylon and the buyer will give the slaves to the messenger to bring them back to the seller. The seller also has to give back the promissory note for the purchase price. Cf. the purchase document Camb 309 (BM 30916).
Author: Maarja Seire (09/10/2020)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: See the duplicate BM 30698 (Camb 388).
Author: Maarja Seire (09/10/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); mâr banûtu (status of a citizen); šīmu (price)
Comments: Cf. Camb 388 (BM 30698) - annulment of this purchase.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/10/2020)

Main Objects: (without specification); bītu (house); broken/unclear
Comments: The tablet is slightly broken. The sellers got the slaves from an exchange deal with Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, in which a house in Borsippa was exchanged for 2 slaves. Now, they are selling the slaves to Kalbāya (broken context).    Cf. Camb 388 and Camb 309 where the same slaves are mentioned. Van Driel notes that the BM 32105+ (Camb 399) looks identical to this one. Perhaps a duplicate?
Author: Maarja Seire (09/10/2020)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); kaspu (silver); šaṭāru (record)
Comments: The document is fragmentary. It is probably related to a division of inheritance.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/10/2020)

Main Objects: \N
Comments: Cf. Camb 377 (BM 31900). Both Cam 399 and Bertin 979 have only BM 32105.   According to Zadok 2009, p. 234 the tablet belongs to Nūr-Papsukkal archive. However, Van Driel suggests that BM 31900 (Camb 377) looks identical to this one. In there, the connection to Egibi archive is established through Itti-Marduk-balāṭu//Egibi. Perhaps a duplicate of Camb 377?
Author: Maarja Seire (09/10/2020)

Author: Ivo Martins (29/10/2020)

Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (29/10/2020)

Main Objects: Bēl; bīt kitinnê (clothes' chest); dannu (vat); eleppu (boat); Ezida (temple of Nabû in Borsippa); Nabû; šikaru rēštû (first-draft beer); šipirtu (letter order; message); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Comments: The tablet contains two letters. The first is a letter from Aḫḫēmāya to Iddināya (ll. 1-rev. 21) asking for information about Iddināya's trip, and instructing him to forward other letters (to Nabû-ahhē-iddin and Bel-aplu-iddin). In addition, Ahhēmāya askes for information on a shipment of beer, and for the return of empty containers (to Borsippa).       The second letter (ll. rev. 22-l.e. 2’) is from Balāṭu to Iddināya asking him (and the rest of the travel group) for information and instructions.
Author: Ivo Martins (30/10/2020)

Main Objects: Bēl; bītu (house); Nabû; nišū bīti (people of the household); ṭuppu (tablet, record)
Comments: Letter of Nabû-aḫḫē-iddin (likely the šākin ṭēmi of Borsippa mentioned in BM 87313) to Rēmūt-Bēl, who is away. Nabû-aḫḫē-iddin informs on the well-being of  Rēmūt-Bēl's household, but the main aim of the correspondence seems to be to instruct Rēmūt-Bēl on his contacts with court officials (probably in Susa) on behalf of the governor. In addition, the governor instructs that further correspondence should be sent via Kuṣrāya.
Author: Ivo Martins (06/11/2020)

Main Objects: bītu (house); immeru (sheep); Marduk; Nanāya; šubtu (base, stand); Sutītu
Comments: Letter sent by Rē’indu to Rēmūt-Bēl concerning the well-being of the family. Rē’indu says that she is unable to draw income from sacrifices before Sutītu and the cult soccle of Marduk.
Author: Ivo Martins (09/11/2020)

Main Objects: ahu (half); asurrû (foundation wall); bītu (house); gišru (bridge); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); ūru (roof)
Comments: The length of the lease is not mentioned. Note that the tablet says that the house is at the disposal of the lessee from the first day of Ayyār (month II), which means that the document was written 8 days after 'starting the lease'. The yearly payment will be done in two payments. Per year, the lessor will deduct 4 š of the rent due to repairs undertaken by the lessee.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/11/2020)

Main Objects: Bēl; bītu (house); dātu ša šarri (royal law); kaspu (silver); maddattu (rent, compensation); Nabû; purussû (decision); qallu (slave); šumu (name)
Comments: Marduk-nāṣir-apli bought a slave called Nabû-šēpāt-šu-šuṣbat from Nabû-uballiṭ. However, Nabû-aplu-iddin claims that it is his lost slave called Nabû-killanni who was sold. Nabû-aplu-iddin asks for a compensation for the time the slave has been in someone else's house. See NaBuCCo for the full paraphrase.
Author: Maarja Seire (09/11/2020)

Author: Maarja Seire (20/11/2020)

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: The buyer gave Itti-Marduk-balāṭu silver to pay for the baker (slave) he bought. However, Itti-Marduk-balāṭu did not give this silver to the seller. Now, his son, Marduk-nāṣir-apli is paying to the seller the silver (and its interest) owed by his father, according to the promissory note that had been drawn up.
Author: Maarja Seire (20/11/2020)

Main Objects: Bēl; kaspu peṣû bitqu nuhhutu (white scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); Nabû; rašûtu (credit); ṣabītu (gazelle)
Comments: The debtor swears an oath: he promises to pay his creditor. If he fails to pay by month V day 2, he will have to give his creditor 4(?) gazelles instead by month V day 15.
Author: Maarja Seire (20/11/2020)

Nabû-nāṣir is the seller, but it is not clear who the two women are -  is he representing the two women in the purchase, or are they just neighbors?

Comments: Nabû-zēru-ibni has sold 4 animals to Marduk-nāṣir-apli, but has to yet deliver them. The seller and his son swear and oath to Marduk-nāṣir-apli that they will deliver the animals by a certain day. If they fail to do so, they will pay barley and dates what remain from a promissory note owed by them.

Main Objects: hubullu (interest); kaspu (silver); kaspu qalû (refined silver); qanû (plot of land); rašûtu (credit); ṭuppu (tablet, record); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Nabû-bān-ahi will speak to royal scribes, who will seal a tablet which will be given to Neriglissar. If that does not take place, Nabû-ahhē-iddin will give the silver to Neriglissar, not to the creditor Nabû-bān-ahi. See BM 30232 (EvM 22).
Author: Maarja Seire (08/03/2021)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qanû (plot of land); rašûtu (credit); ṭuppi apilti (purchase document); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Maarja Seire (08/03/2021)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); rašûtu (credit); šīmu (price); ṭuppu (tablet, record); zittu (share)
Comments: It seems like the three sons represent the father (creditor) in receiving the payment. The debtor is represented by Nabû-ahhē-iddin, who acts on Neriglissar's orders.
Author: Maarja Seire (08/03/2021)

Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); rašûtu (credit)
Author: Maarja Seire (08/03/2021)

Comments: Some of the lines are fragmentary. See Sack 1972, no. 21 (BM 31358). The duplicate BM 32095 (Bertin 291) is even more fragmentary.
Author: Maarja Seire (08/03/2021)

Main Objects: (without specification); arad-šarrūtu (royal servant/slave); kaspu (silver); mâr banûtu (status of a citizen); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Purchase of two slaves but the slave designation is not mentioned.
Author: Maarja Seire (10/03/2021)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); šīmu (price)
Comments: The tablet is slightly damaged. The tablet is a receipt for something that was sold to Neriglissar through proxy. What is sold is not mentioned in this document. Sack interprets it as if the Ša-nāšišu woman was sold, but it seems like she sold something else.
Author: Maarja Seire (10/03/2021)

Main Objects: gabrû (copy); kaspu (silver); qallu (slave); šīmu (price); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: A purchase by proxy has taken place. This document states who is the real new owner of the sold slave.
Author: Maarja Seire (10/03/2021)

Main Objects: atru (additional payment); bītu (house); bītu abtu (ruined house); kaspu (silver); kaspu šibirtu (silver in pieces); lubāru (garment); mišihtu (measurement); mūtaq Nergal ša hadê (thoroughway of Nergal of Joy); sūqu lā āṣû (dead-end street)
Comments: Some of the lines are fragmentary. Cf. Camb 423
Author: Maarja Seire (10/03/2021)

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); qallatu (female slave); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); šīmu (price); šumu (name); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Some of the lines are very fragmentary. It seems that Iddin-Nabû has sold a slave of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, his brother, without his approval (ina la qerēbi 'without his presence' and ina puzri 'in concealment'). This document states that the purchase price has to be paid to the buyer by Iddin-Nabû in the name of Itti-Marduk-balāṭu, i.e. the purchase contract is annulled (?). Note that NaBuCCo has a different interpretation as they read ina puhri instead of ina puzri (written twice as pu-uz-ru).
Author: Maarja Seire (10/03/2021)

Main Objects: bītu (house); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); šumu (name); u’iltu (promissory note)
Author: Maarja Seire (10/03/2021)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); gišimmaru (date palm grove); kaspu peṣû (white silver); nudunnû (dowry); unātī bīti (household goods); zēru (arable land); zēru kišubbû (unbuilt land, fallow land); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms)
Author: Maarja Seire (12/04/2021)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); amtu (female slave); bītu (house); dīnu (lawsuit); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); nudunnû (dowry); puhru (assembly); šaṭāru (record); unātī bīti (household goods); zēru (arable land); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms); zēru zaqpu u mērešu (land planted with date palms and grain-cultivated land)
Comments: The tablet lists the dowry items for Marduk-iqīšanni and Erištu. They have been fully paid what was promised, besides the slave woman Balṭammu and her child Ubārtu, for whom a compensatory payment of 2 1/3 mina of silver along with another slave woman, Malākalu was given.  In addition, the document lists 10 more slaves which were sold to Anu-[...]-apli by Marduk-nāṣir-apli in the presence of a puhru (assembly). For those slaves, Marduk-iqīšanni and Erištu promise to have no claims.
Author: Maarja Seire (12/04/2021)

Main Objects: aštapiru (slave); bītu (estate, plot of land); bītu epšu (built house); broken/unclear; huṣṣu (reed hut); kaspu bitqu nuhhutu (scrap silver with 1/8 alloy); mūtaq Nergal ša hadê (thoroughway of Nergal of Joy); qanû (plot of land); šīmu (price); zēru (arable land)
Comments: The husband gives his wife slaves and land instead of her dowry money of 26 5/6 minas of silver.

Main Objects: kaspu (silver); Marduk; Nabû; nudunnû (dowry); qanû (plot of land); unātī bīti (household goods); zittu (inheritance share)
Comments: Donation of silver, a plot of land and household goods by a father to his daughter as “dowry and inheritance”. Note that both the father and the mother are said to have "taken a copy" of the tablet in the final line.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (22/12/2021)

Main Objects: eqlu (field); kaspu bitqu (silver with 1/8 alloy); rīhtu/rīhitu (remainder, rest); šīmu (price)
Comments: The silver is the remainder of the purchase price of a field.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (22/12/2021)

Main Objects: Bēl; kurummatu (ration); mītūtu (death); Nabû; nishu (expenses, payment for workers); nudunnû (dowry); šaṭāru (record); širiktu (gift; votive offering); ṭuppu (tablet, record); u’iltu (promissory note); zēru zaqpu (land planted with date palms)
Comments: Dialogue contract between a woman and her father-in-law about an orchard that she had received from her brother after her father’s death and that was included in her dowry. Her husband seems to have been deceased at this point. An arrangement is made that she will enjoy an income from the land but that the land will eventually pass to her son.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (23/12/2021)

Main Objects: abulli Ištar (Ištar gate); akalu (bread/food); bītu rabû (main building); huṣṣu (reed hut); ipru (food); kaspu (silver); lubuštu (clothing); makkūru (property); Marduk; Nabû; nudunnû (dowry); piššatu (oil); qanû (plot of land); rīmūtu (gift); ṣēru (steppe); širiktu (gift; votive offering); Zarpanītu
Comments: This testament focuses on the female heir of the testator: his (second) wife Qunnabatu; his daughters Amat-Ninlil and Nidinti-Nanāya; his daughter-in-law Habaṣirtu.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (23/12/2021)

Main Objects: bītu (house); hubullu (interest); idū (rent); kaspu (silver); maškanu (pledge); nudunnû (dowry)
Comments: The silver is specified as belonging to the dowry of the creditor’s wife.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (23/12/2021)

Main Objects: bītu (house); tibnu (straw)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (23/12/2021)

Main Objects: bītu (house); maškanu (pledge); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Top of tablet broken off. About the settlement of a debt covered by a pledge.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (24/12/2021)

Main Objects: bītu (house); dullu (work); harrānu (street); kaspu (silver); kirû (orchard); lē’û (register); mašīhu ša šarri (measure of the king); suluppū (dates); u’iltu (promissory note)
Comments: Belongs to BM 96113
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (24/12/2021)

Comments: The left side of the tablet is broken off; difficult to understand. About an orchard that was given as a pledge and sold to the creditor. Belongs with BM 28857 (Dar 12).
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (24/12/2021)

Main Objects: alpu sāmu (red/brown bovine); hurubbu (cut of meat; part of animal body); kaspu peṣû bitqu (white silver with 1/8 alloy); šīmu (price)

Comments: Belongs to BM 29379.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Main Objects: ebūru (harvest); Marduk; maṣṣartu (duty, service; guarding); Nabû; nudunnû (dowry); palāhu (to honour); suddudu (caretaking); zēru (arable land)
Comments: Qudāšu donates a field that she had received from her husband in lieu of her dowry to her son, in exchange for care in old age. Belongs together with BM 28902.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Main Objects: amēlūtu (slaves); bīt mēreši (grain-cultivated land); ebūru (harvest); kurummatu (ration); Nabû; nudunnû (dowry); zēru gišimmarī zaqpu (land planted with date palms)
Comments: The tablet is a copy of a damaged original (hi-pí). Ahātu donates her dowry (land, slaves) to her husband’s son (presumably also her own son) in lieu for care in old age. The woman’s husband and the donee’s sister (presumably, her daughter) are present as witnesses.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Main Objects: gugallu (tax payable to the gugallu); šissinnu (gardener’s remuneration); suluppū (dates)
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Main Objects: kurummatu (ration); sahlû (cress); uṭṭatu (barley)
Comments: Receipt of barley and cress rations for three months.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Main Objects: dannu (vat); kurummatu (ration); šikaru (beer)
Comments: Receipt of beer as rations for three or four months. Belongs together with BM 96464.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Main Objects: dannu (vat); šamaššammū (sesame); šikaru ṭābu (full-strength beer)
Comments: Obverse damaged and difficult to read. Assignment to the Bēlia’u archive uncertain. Probably belongs to the dossier about Rēmūt-Nabû//Basia.
Author: Caroline Waerzeggers (03/01/2022)

Comments: Division of land into 33 shares of the "House of Bēlia’u" located in the hanšû of the Kidin-Sîn family. Three individuals of the Bēlia’u family and three brothers of the Kidin-Sîn family are involved.

Comments: Two brothers receive outstanding debt notes from a relative as a part of their inheritance. One heir receives debt notes due from Līšir, the other one debt notes due from a certain Nabû-it[...].

Comments: This is a composite edition of 9 casts made from the same original tablet. RA 26, no. 10 is another cast. The debtors need to pay for 20 vats of beer.

Comments: This is a house rent contract in the guise of a promissory note with house pledge. The creditor will live in the house for two years.
